22-063EC.summary: Recommendation to conduct a study session on the Commission's Disclosure Policy and the Disclosure Policy Benchmarking Report; and, if necessary, adopt resolution amending the Rules and Procedures of the Ethics Commission to include the Disclosure Policy.Commissioner Shotwell spoke; and presented the report.Commissioner Fiedler spoke; and continued the report.Commissioner Wise spoke.Commissioner Fiedler spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Fiedler and Commissioner Shotwell.Vice Chair Pollack spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Vice Chair Pollack and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Commissioner Wise spoke.Page 2 of 7411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 3:00 PMWEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 12, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHETHICS COMMISSION MINUTESTaylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Wise and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.Chair Morales spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner Añorve spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.Commissioner Fiedler spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Shotwell and Commissioner Fiedler.Chair Morales spoke.Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Commissioner Shotwell spoke.A dialogue ensued between Commissioner Shotwell and Taylor Anderson, Deputy City Attorney.A motion was made by Commissioner Wise, seconded by Commissioner Fiedler, to approve recommendation, as amended, to bring the item back at the Ethics Commission meeting of Wednesday, November 9, 2022, with the addition of the election policy and changes requested by the Commission.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 7 - Raúl Añorve, Lani De Benedictis, Luke Fiedler, J. P. Shotwell, Susan Wise, Barbara Pollack and Margo Morales4.
